decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive play and controlling the board. The key concept revolves around efficiently playing creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Heretic Cathar, along with disruptive spells like Path to Exile and Spell Queller. It also includes cards that generate value over time, such as Tireless Tracker and Collected Company. With strong mana acceleration through Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and outvalue the opponent's plays.

The central theme of this deck revolves around utilizing the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle land and Scapeshift combo to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Hour of Promise, while also ensuring that Valakut is active with Prismatic Omen. The deck also includes tutor cards like Summoner's Pact and Primeval Titan to search for key pieces. Additionally, the deck includes some removal and creature acceleration to provide flexibility and further support the overall strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Death's Shadow as a powerful threat early in the game by using cards like Thoughtseize, Serum Visions, and Thought Scour to set up the graveyard for fueling Delve creatures like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler. The deck also includes disruption like Inquisition of Kozilek and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's game plan, along with removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push. By efficiently using the graveyard, disruption, and powerful threats, this deck aims to control the board and win through aggressive combat damage.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, enabling the player to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Eldrazi Titans. It also includes disruption and removal spells like Collective Brutality, Fatal Push, and Thought-Knot Seer to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with its powerful threats and versatile removal options.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo with Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to produce unlimited mana, allowing for an infinite combo with Walking Ballista. It also utilizes creatures like Duskwatch Recruiter and Eternal Witness to tutor for key pieces in the deck. Collected Company and Chord of Calling provide additional creature synergy and flexibility. The deck aims to create a strong board presence using a toolbox of creatures and combo pieces, while also having the ability to win the game quickly with the infinite mana combo.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing its own life total to strengthen Death's Shadow, a powerful threat that grows in size based on the controller's life total. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Stubborn Denial to control the board while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, backed up by versatile spells like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command.

This deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and disruption spells to put pressure on the opponent. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Path to Exile, while also generating value with Lingering Souls and card advantage with Liliana of the Veil. The creatures in the deck, such as Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino, are difficult to deal with and can quickly close out games. The deck features a mix of removal, hand disruption, and threats to keep the opponent on the back foot and secure a win through aggressive plays.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats while deploying threats of its own such as Spell Queller and Geist of Saint Traft. The inclusion of Thundermaw Hellkite adds another powerful threat to close out the game. The mana base supports the control aspect of the deck, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively and utilizing the Death's Shadow mechanic to quickly reduce your own life total and power up your creatures. With a mix of control elements like Stubborn Denial and removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also presenting a fast clock. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thought Scour to manipulate both players' hands and graveyards, the deck seeks to control the pace of the game and seize the advantage.

The deck focuses on deploying low-cost, high-power creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes ways to control the board with removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push, while also providing card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions. The goal is to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the game through efficient creature threats and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to a low amount in order to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat on the battlefield. By using cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to lower your own life total and disrupt your opponent's game plan, you can overwhelm them with a large Death's Shadow and other efficient threats like Gurmag Angler and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also includes disruption like Stubborn Denial and removal spells to control the board and protect your key creatures.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing a board presence with Faeries. It utilizes cards like Bitterblossom, Spellstutter Sprite, and Mistbind Clique to control the board and counter spells. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with threats. Additionally, it has hand disruption with Inquisition of Kozilek and Collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck is versatile and can adapt to different situations, making it a strong contender in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The Aggro Abzan deck focuses on aggressive creature threats like Siege Rhino and Tarmogoyf, supported by efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Fatal Push. The deck also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the board and grind out advantages over the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's various color requirements, enabling it to consistently deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Big Red control deck utilizes a high amount of direct damage spells and board wipes to control the opponent's board while also disrupting their graveyard with Relic of Progenitus. Its win conditions include powerful creatures like Stormbreath Dragon and Inferno Titan, backed up by Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Koth of the Hammer for additional value and burn. Blood Moon is used to disrupt opponent's mana bases, while cards like Scrying Sheets and Mind Stone provide card advantage and ramp. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents with its array of threats and removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan. By using cards like Through the Breach and Scapeshift, players can quickly deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent by repeatedly triggering Valakut's ability when they have enough Mountains on the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Lightning Bolt and Relic of Progenitus to control the game until the combo can be assembled.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder, while setting up the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle combo with cards like Scapeshift and Primeval Titan. The goal is to have Valakut deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent by sacrificing lands and triggering its ability multiple times in one turn. Cards like Prismatic Omen and Hour of Promise help to ensure that the combo is successful and that the opponent's life total is quickly depleted.
